data.title: Commission fears low turnout in polls
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) expressed concern over low voter turnout estimates for the nationwide election of Provincial Administrative Organisation (PAO) members to be held on Feb 1.

data.title: Thai Embassy in Yangon to accept only e-Visa applications starting January 1
data.description: The Thai Embassy in Yangon has announced that it will only accept applications for Thai visas through the e-Visa system starting January 1, 2025.

data.title: Chiang Mai Design Week: Celebrating 10 Years of Creative City Transformation
data.description: Celebrating its 10th year, Chiang Mai Design Week 2024 (CMDW2024), organized by Thailand's Creative Economy Agency (Public Organization), or CEA, has become a key platform for local creators, designers, artists, and craftsmen.

data.title: Innovation in cellular health using NMN nutrients and exosomes for Thais
data.description: NihonChojyu Clinic addresses health and beauty issues from ageing and cellular degeneration with cutting-edge treatments. Founded on "restoring health from cells," Dr Masatoshi Egoshi is visiting Thailand to showcase innovations for health and beauty-conscious individuals.

data.title: Indorama Ventures unveils The Reimagined 360 Gallery, a sustainable hub
data.description: Indorama Ventures, a global sustainable chemical leader, unveils its revamped 360 Gallery in Bangkok's Ocean Tower II. This cutting-edge exhibit showcases innovations in sustainable chemistry, highlighting their role in building a better, greener future.

data.title: Indorama Ventures Unveils Sustainable Innovation Hub: The Reimagined 360 Gallery
data.description: Bangkok, 12 December 2024 – Global sustainable chemical leader Indorama Ventures Public Company Limited has transformed its corporate exhibition space into a cutting-edge sustainability showcase. The newly renovated 360 Gallery in Bangkok's Ocean Tower II demonstrates how sustainable chemistry shapes a better tomorrow.

data.title: Central Retail unveils the new Central Chidlom
data.description: The newly renovated store underscores Central Retail’s commitment to revitalising its business operations nationwide

data.title: Bare-knuckle politics
data.description: Bare-knuckle politics

data.title: Cold climes on radar for two weeks
data.description: The temperature, especially in upper Thailand, is predicted to fall slightly until Dec 27 as a new high-pressure area is spreading into the upper part of the country, while the South is being warned to brace for more rain, the Thai Meteorological Department (TMD) said.

data.title: '3 B's' give hope to the smaller clubs
data.description: Back in the 1960s as a teenager I would regularly visit Elm Park to watch my home town team Reading in the old Third Division. Among the visiting sides were Brighton, Bournemouth and Brentford. Just like Reading, these clubs looked destined to stay in the lower divisions forever although by some miracle Reading made it to the Premier League in 2006 for an all-too-brief stay.

data.title: Ishii's army ready to strike
data.description: Reigning champions Thailand will be aiming to claim their second win in Group A as they take on Malaysia today in the Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup 2024 at Rajamangala National Stadium.

data.title: B300bn allocated for six dual-track railway projects
data.description: The Transport Ministry aims to invest almost 300 billion baht to expand a raft of dual railway tracks next year.

data.title: Premier's Malaysia trip to help boost ties
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will pay an official visit to Malaysia and co-chair the 7th annual consultation on Monday in Putrajaya, a city south of Kuala Lumpur, according to deputy government spokesperson Sasikarn Watthanachan.

data.title: 'Koh Kut sovereignty clear-cut'
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra insisted on Thai sovereignty over the island of Koh Kut in Trat, adding that the 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) regarding maritime claims in the Gulf of Thailand only serves as a framework for talks on the issue between Thailand and Cambodia.

data.title: Maris to visit Myanmar next week
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa will hold talks with Myanmar official next Thursday to expedite the release of four Thai fishermen, according to the Defence Ministry.

data.title: Murder victim's wife drops out of race
data.description: The widow of murder victim Chaimet Sitsanitphong, who had been eyed by Pheu Thai to run in Prachin Buri

data.title: Commission fears low turnout in polls
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) yesterday expressed concern over low voter turnout estimates for the nationwide election of Provincial Administrative Organisation (PAO) members to be held on Feb 1.

data.title: Thaksin says PM to lead new anti-drug task force
data.description: The government will set up a special task force chaired by the prime minister in a bid to combat the scourge of illicit drugs.

data.title: Consultants pay $650m to settle US opioid case
data.description: BOSTON - The multinational consulting firm McKinsey & Co has agreed to pay $650 million to resolve a US criminal investigation into its work advising the opioid manufacturer Purdue Pharma on how to boost sales.

data.title: Palang Pracharath kicks out dissenting MPs
data.description: The Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) has officially expelled 20 MPs who defected following a dispute between former party secretary-general Thamanat Prompow and present party leader Prawit Wongsuwon.

data.title: Kremlin applauds Trump’s Ukraine comments
data.description: MOSCOW - The Kremlin praised US President-elect Donald Trump on Friday for criticising Ukrainian missile strikes deep into Russian territory but said discussions about deploying European troops to keep a possible future peace in Ukraine were premature.

data.title: Bridgestone Joins Isuzu's the Future Diesel Engine Launch Event
data.description: Bridgestone Sales (Thailand) Co., Ltd., a key business partner in developing high-performance original equipment tyres under the BRIDGESTONE brand for Isuzu D-Max and MU-X, joined Isuzu

data.title: Thaksin affirmed that no other country has claimed sovereignty over Ko Kut
data.description: Former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra has clarified the Ko Kut issue, emphasizing that no one disputes its status as part of Thailand.

data.title: Phu Kradueng reopening planned before Christmas
data.description: Phu Kradueng  National Park is expected to reopen before Dec 25 for tourists to celebrate the New Year holiday on the famous mountain in Loei province, officials said on Friday.

data.title: Korean lawmakers try again to impeach president
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung said on Friday the best way to restore order in the country is to impeach President  Yoon Suk Yeol , a day ahead of second planned parliamentary vote over Yoon’s short-lived imposition of martial law.

data.title: Chang unveils unpasteurised beer in innovative aluminium bottle
data.description: Brewery aims to cash in on increasing demand in premium segment

data.title: Huge illegal drug lab exposed in Syria
data.description: DOUMA - The industrial-scale drug lab sat just up a hill from a main road on the western edge of Damascus, the city that was the seat of power for the Assad family which long denied any links to the narcotics trade.

data.title: Nation TV investigative programme wins Anti-Corruption honour
data.description: A Nation TV programme, “Fact Investigative”, on Friday won the Anti-Corruption Awards 2024 for a TV programme campaigning for good governance.

data.title: Thai foreign minister to negotiate release of 4 captured fishing crew
data.description: Prime minister wants Foreign Minister Maris Sangiampongsa to negotiate their urgent release despite the Myanmar envoy’s assurances

data.title: Thailand among top 10 high-risk nations under Trump’s 2.0 govt
data.description: Kingdom ranks second in ‘Trump Risk Index’ due to its significant trade surplus with the US and low defence spending

data.title: Asian scammers nabbed in Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA - A total of 13 Chinese and Korean suspects have been arrested in Pattaya for operating a  call centre scam .

data.title: Flood alert for South of Thailand as river levels rise
data.description: Residents in low-lying areas of Nakhon Si Thammarat are advised to move valuables and vulnerable individuals to higher ground

data.title: Ratchaburi man busted with 50 rare exotic animals
data.description: A man has been arrested at his home in Ratchaburi for possessing dozens of  endangered wild animals  including cotton-top tamarin monkeys. He admitted to buying them online, police said on Friday.

data.title: CP Family climbs to 19th in global wealth rankings
data.description: Thai tycoon’s net worth estimated at $44.1 bn on Bloomberg’s Billionaires Index

data.title: Pichai rules out VAT hike to 15%, considers product-based tax reform
data.description: Finance Ministry ‘exploring ways to modernise tax structure’

data.title: Samui ferry operator considers lifting EV ban
data.description: SURAT THANI - The operator of ferries serving Koh Samui says it will reconsider lifting its ban on electric vehicles (EVs) early next year after installing firefighting equipment on all routes from the southern mainland to resort islands.
